title: Structure 2015 Wallula Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: This wine's assortment of herbal aromas are followed by black olive, green pepper, green leaf and smoke scents. Its cherry and plum flavors are elegant and sophisticated, with a dried tobacco finish. It comes off as quite green.

title: Tangent 2016 Paragon Vineyard Pinot Gris (Edna Valley)
description: Tight and bright on the nose with citrus and lime blossoms, this stainless bottling also offers slightly warmer aromas of nectarine and peach as well on the nose. There's a hint of grass clipping on the front of the palate, but then it opens toward lemon, lime and tonic water flavors.

title: Thomas Goss 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: This is a pleasing, approachable wine, offering ripe blackberry fruit, licorice and a herbal, savory backbone. The palate finds a nice balance of juicy ripe berry fruit and silky texture but the oak tannins are a little clunky and chewy.

title: Torre a Oriente 2015 Biancuzita  (Falanghina del Sannio)
description: Fragrant wild flower, yellow stone-fruit and wild herb aromas come together on this. The medium-bodied palate offers dried apricot, orange peel and a hint of bitter almond alongside tangy acidity.

title: Triacca 2014 La Madonnina Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: This opens with delicate aromas of black-skinned berry, coffee bean and underbrush. The medium-bodied palate shows black cherry, star anise and white pepper alongside smooth tannins.

title: Ultima Tulie 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Caramelized lemon wedge, poached apples and a touch of citrus pith show on the nose of this bottling. There is solid zip to the sip, where ripe rich flavors of pear, apple and cooked lemons arise.

title: Villa Dria 2015 Chardonnay-Gros Manseng White (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: This is an attractive wine, well poised between perfumed honey flavors and soft acidity. It is still fruity, even after three years, with a crisp and tangy edge. The wine is just right to drink now.

title: Villa Dria 2017 Jardin Secret Gros Manseng (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: A medium-sweet wine, from one of the region's star grapes, this has a honeyed edge along with tangy, zesty acidity. Fruit and final crispness contrast with the sweetness.

title: Villa Matilde 2017 Roccamonfina Falanghina (Roccamonfina)
description: Aromas of tropical fruit and honeysuckle lead the nose. The fruity palate doles out pineapple, honeydew melon and yellow apple set against tangy acidity.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro Single Vineyard Red (Tejo)
description: This lightly wood-aged wine is spicy, packed with fruit and with a firm, dry core of tannins. As it develops, this wine that comes from a single vineyard in northern Tejo will fill out, smoothing the rough edges of the tannins. Drink from late 2018.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro Single Vineyard

title: Yalumba 2016 The Virgilius Viognier (Eden Valley)
description: Aromas of nuts, smoke, and bread combine on the nose over tones of peach and flowers. While the palate's richness and oak flavors are on the clunky side, nevertheless, lovers of full-bodied whites will enjoy this barrel-chested style.

title: Youngberg Hill Vineyards 2015 Bailey Block Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: Spicy and leesy, this opens with brambly berry fruit and a slightly earthy scent. The first bottle seemed a bit disjointed, the second tighter and cleaner (both were sealed with bare screwcaps). It should benefit from another couple of years in bottle.

title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2016 Colheita Tardia Late Harvest White (Tejo)
description: This sweet wine is full of ripe, sugary fruit. Touches of honey and enough lemon maintain the wine's fresher side. Attractive and poised, it's light in character and ready to drink.

title: Agricola Bellaria 2016 Ottant'anni Coda di Volpe (Irpinia)
description: Aromas of chamomile flower and a whiff of toasted hazelnut follow over to the palate along with baked apple and citrus. It closes on a pleasantly bitter note.

title: Apaltagua 2015 Envero Gran Reserva Estate Bottled Apalta Vineyard Selection Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
description: Abundant woody aromas and varietally familiar spiced berry scents introduce this wine. Rough tannins make for a hard palate, with black olive and peppery blackberry flavors. Oaky nutmeg and baking spice notes dominate the finish.
designation: Envero Gran Reserva Estate Bottled Apalta Vineyard Selection

title: Bodegas Fos 2016 Maceración Carbonica  (Rioja)
description: This wine's light, herbal berry aromas include a touch of olive. A solid though basic Tempranillo, it offers fresh black plum flavors and feels unrefined and a touch aggressive on the finish.

title: Boisset America 2014 Christophe Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine offers a fist of grippy tannin around a simple structure of soft approachable cassis and red cherry. The undertone is marked by herbal compost earthiness and oak.

title: Bridgman 2016 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: An early red release from the vintage, this is light in color and notably blue fruited for a Merlot, with spice and orange peel accents. The flavors bring more of the same, adding boysenberry and plum notes that coat the palate before tapering on the finish. You'd never have it pegged as Merlot, but it's tasty all the same.

title: Bud's Bloom 2015 Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Sourced from a single vineyard, this vintage blends three clones: 777, 115 and Pommard. It has a leathery scent that carries into the flavors. The palate shows hints of tomato, fruit leather and chicken stock. More bottle age may bring short-term improvement; the jury's out on that.

title: Casca Wines 2017 Cascas Branco White (Douro)
description: This perfumed blend that includes 50% Malvasia is light and crisp. It has hints of yellow fruits as well as citrus, giving a wine with great character. Drink during 2018.

title: Caves Velhas 2017 Bucellas Arinto (Bucelas)
description: Bucelas is the center of Arinto production in Lisboa, giving wines that, like this, are crisp and creamy, bright and rounded. This tangy, citrus flavored wine is ready to drink now.

title: Chacewater 2014 Merlot (Sierra Foothills)
description: Good and grapy, this wine has lots of dark-fruit flavors and enough body and tannin for a grippy texture. It is very clean and well made and will be a good go-to wine for casual occasions.

title: Château Vincens 2016 Malbec Malbec (Cahors)
description: This fruity, spicy entry-level wine is ripe and generously tannic. Its dry core is surrounded by juicy black fruits, ripe tannins and balanced acidity. Made to drink young, it will be ready from late 2018.

title: Clos d'Audhuy 2016 Les Polissons Malbec (Cahors)
description: This is a soft, open style of Malbec, designed for early drinking. Black fruits and soft tannins give a ripe, juicy character, lifted by final acidity. Drink now.

title: Companhia das Quintas 2016 Quinta do Cardo Siria (Beira Interior)
description: The Siria grape is used in these high-altitude wines. Its crisp acidity and lemon and honey flavors are delicious and refreshing. A delightful wine, it's bright with acidity and ready to drink for its great fruitiness.

title: Famille Laplace 2016 Domaine Mouréou Tannat-Cabernet Franc (Madiran)
description: From one of the properties owned by the Laplace family, this blend of Tannat and Cabernet Franc is juicy, ripe and all about black fruits. Soft tannins support a juicy, generous wine that will be ready to drink by late 2018.

title: Georges Vigouroux 2016 Pigmentum Malbec (Cahors)
description: Pure black fruit without any hint of wood, this wine is packed with blackberry and black-currant flavors. With crisp acidity, ripe tannins and forward fruitiness, it is ready to drink.

title: Hahn 2016 SLH Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Almond, yellow peach, daffodil and noticeable oak aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Dried lime peels, apple slices and lemon juice dominate the palate, which feels a tad dried out rather than fresh.

title: Harmony Cellars 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated dark red-fruit and a prominent cigar-box aromas show on the nose of this bottling, named after the tiny coastal town where the winery is headquartered. Cedar-led wood spice dominates the palate.

title: Helix by Reininger 2013 Bacchus Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: From one of the state's finest vineyards, this offers high-toned raspberry, blueberry and spice aromas and a well balanced, fruitful palate.
